Description: RNA-seq data from lung cancer patients was processed through a pipeline to identify immunogenic neoantigen candidates from chimeric RNAs based on discordant and split paired-end reads. The KIF5B [Exon 1-15] -RET [Exon 12-19] fusion gene was chosen as a primary candidate. Affinity of neopeptides formed by the translated fusion junction was tested in silico using MHCNuggets. The Enzyme Linked Immunosorbent Spot Assay will be used in vitro to assess CD8+ T cell response to peptide and mRNA stimulation. Single cell 5' gene expression and T cell receptor mapping will be used to evaluate clonotype expansion to improve adoptive immune therapies administered in parallel.
SearchResultBody: ESP03E. Discovering Immunogenic Neopeptides from Chimeric RNAs to Develop Vaccines for Lung Cancer Treatment
Title: Discovering Immunogenic Neopeptides from Chimeric RNAs to Develop Vaccines for Lung Cancer Treatment
